intro: Phacelia stebbinsii, commonly known as Stebbins' phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and clusters of small, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid environments. It is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats, where it plays a role in supporting local pollinators. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in some areas.
